marketNews.title: Indonesian Trade Balance Surplus Below Expectation
marketNews.content: BPS [noted](https://www.bps.go.id/id/pressrelease/2024/11/15/2344/ekspor-oktober-2024-mencapai-us-24-41-miliar--naik-10-69-persen-dibanding-september-dan-impor-oktober-2024-senilai-us-21-94-miliar--naik-16-54-persen-dibanding-september-2024.html) that Indonesia's trade balance surplus for October 2024 decreased to US$2.48 billion (-29% YoY, -23% MoM), falling below the consensus expectation which projected a surplus of US$3.05 billion. This result marks the 54th consecutive month of surplus. The decrease in Indonesia's trade balance surplus in October 2024 was caused by import growth of +18% YoY (vs. September 2024: +8.6% YoY), exceeding the consensus expectation of +7.1% YoY. On the other hand, export growth was only +10% YoY (vs. September 2024: +6.3%), although significantly higher than the consensus expectation of +3.8% YoY. The details are as follows: - Non-Oil and Gas Trade Balance Surplus Decreased to US$4.8 billion Non-oil and gas exports in October 2024 grew to US$23.1 billion (+11% YoY, +10% MoM). This result was supported by almost all commodity groups, with fats and oils of animal or vegetable origin (+25% YoY) experiencing the largest growth. Sectorally, non-oil and gas export growth was driven by the non-oil and gas processing industry products (+14% YoY), mainly through CPO exports. In October 2024, the largest non-oil and gas exports were directed to China (-2% YoY), the US (+29% YoY), and India (+8% YoY). Meanwhile, non-oil and gas imports were recorded at US$18.3 billion (+18% YoY, +12% MoM) in October 2024. Non-oil and gas import growth occurred across all main non-oil and gas commodity groups, except for machinery and mechanical appliances and their parts. The largest growth came from electrical machinery and equipment and their parts, which grew by +18% YoY. The largest sources of non-oil and gas imports were China (+20% YoY), Japan (-3.8% YoY), and Singapore (+41% YoY). - Largest Oil and Gas Deficit in 1 Year Indonesia's oil and gas trade deficit reached US$2.3 billion (+26% YoY, +69% MoM) in October 2024, marking the largest deficit in the last 1 year. This result was caused by higher growth in oil and gas imports (+14% YoY, +45% MoM) compared to the growth in exports (-1.8% YoY, +17% MoM). The high oil and gas imports were driven by increased imports of crude oil (+18% YoY) and petroleum products (+13% YoY). During 10M24, Indonesia's trade balance surplus reached US$24.43 billion (-22% YoY), with a surplus in the non-oil and gas sector of US$41.8 billion (-11% YoY) and a deficit in the oil and gas sector of US$17.4 billion (vs. 10M23: deficit of US$15.8 billion). Key Takeaway The value of Indonesia's trade surplus going forward is at risk of declining/decreasing due to protectionist policies from the elected President Donald Trump, both directly and indirectly. Direct negative impacts may arise from trade between Indonesia-US, where the US contributed 11% of Indonesia's total gross non-oil and gas exports during 10M24. The indirect impact comes via the weakening of the Chinese economy due to the trade war with the US, where China contributed 24% of Indonesia's total gross non-oil and gas exports during 10M24. On the other hand, the continuously widening Indonesian oil and gas deficit underscores the urgency for Indonesia to increase domestic oil and gas production and energy self-sufficiency, which is also one of the main programs/focus areas of the new government under President Prabowo Subianto.

marketNews.title: China's President Xi Jinping Promises Cooperation with Trump's Government
marketNews.content: Chinese President, Xi Jinping, [said](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cx2l4dn802lo) that he pledged to establish cooperation with the US government under the leadership of the elected president, Donald Trump. Xi emphasized that a "new cold war must not happen" and stated that stable relations between China and the US are very important for both parties and the world. Previously, Trump planned to raise import tariffs on Chinese products to 60%.

marketNews.title: Minister of State-Owned Enterprises Orders 8 SOEs to Support Free Nutritious Food Program
marketNews.content: Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, ordered 8 SOEs to successfully implement the Free Nutritious Food program. These companies [include, among others,](https://epaper.bisnis.com/epaper/detail/page/147142/) Bank Rakyat Indonesia ($BBRI), Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI), Bank Mandiri ($BMRI), Telkom Indonesia ($TLKM), Perusahaan Gas Negara ($PGAS), PT PLN, ID Survey, and the Pupuk Indonesia holding company.

marketNews.title: Shell Indonesia Plans to Close All Fuel Stations Amid Tough Competition
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that Shell Indonesia plans to close all of its gas stations (SPBUs) in Indonesia. Previously, Shell had closed 9 SPBU units in Medan. Currently, Shell still operates 215 SPBUs in Indonesia. The Chairman of the Investment Committee of the Oil and Gas Companies Association (Aspermigas), Moshe Rizal, told [Kontan](https://epaper.kontan.co.id/mobile/harian/2024/11/18) that competition among private fuel station operators is quite difficult because they must compete with Pertamina, which controls more than 90% of the fuel market in Indonesia. On the other hand, the President Corporate Relations of Shell Indonesia, Susi Hutapea, stated that the closure of SPBUs in Medan is part of Shell's global strategy to create a business with lower emissions.

marketNews.title: Deputy in Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs Discusses Reviewing Palm Oil Export Levies Policy
marketNews.content: The Deputy in the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Dida Gardera, [said](https://www.tradingview.com/news/reuters.com,2024:newsml_L4N3MP0AQ:0-indonesia-to-review-palm-oil-export-levies-policy-may-not-change/) that his office sees an opportunity to review the CPO export levy tariff every 3-6 months to maintain competitiveness against rival vegetable oils. Despite this, Dida emphasized that the government might choose not to change the policy. The government last revised the CPO export levy regulation in [September 2024](https://snips.stockbit.com/snips-terbaru/pemerintah-turunkan-tarif-pungutan-ekspor-cpo).

tickerNews.title: ADRO Shareholders Approve Additional Dividend up to US$2.6 Billion for Fiscal Year 2023
tickerNews.content: Adaro Energy Indonesia shareholders approved an additional dividend for the 2023 fiscal year of up to US$2.6 billion today, Monday (18/11). However, the GMSLB today did not announce the exact payment amount for this dividend. If ADRO management decides to distribute the dividend at its maximum limit of US$2.6 billion, the dividend per share would be equivalent to 1,359 rupiah per share, assuming an exchange rate of 15,898 rupiah per US dollar, indicating a yield of approximately 36.7% based on ADRO's closing stock price per Monday (18/11) of 3,700 rupiah per share. Furthermore, the GMSLB also approved the change of the company's name to Alamtri Resources Indonesia.

tickerNews.title: BUMI Confirms MOU with Chinese Company for Coal Downstreaming to Methanol
tickerNews.content: The Director General at the Ministry of ESDM, Tri Winarno, [said](https://katadata.co.id/berita/energi/673aa08505cd3/bumi-resources-jalin-kerja-sama-hilirisasi-batu-bara-dengan-perusahaan-cina) that Bumi Resources has signed a memorandum of understanding with a Chinese company regarding the downstream processing of coal into methanol. BUMI's Corporate Secretary, Dileep Srivastava, confirmed the issue but could not yet detail this downstream cooperation plan.

tickerNews.title: DSSA Sells 4.72% Stake in Smartfren ($FREN) to Affiliate Party and Provides Convertible Loan
tickerNews.content: Dian Swastatika Sentosa [announced](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202411/fa313bf516_0a4b13511e.pdf) that it has sold 22.5 billion (4.72%) shares of Smartfren Telecom ($FREN) at a price of 25 rupiah per share to an affiliated party and controller of FREN, PT Bali Media Telekomunikasi. The total transaction value reached 562 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, DSSA's ownership in FREN decreased from 4.72% to 0%. In a separate transaction, DSSA also provided a loan facility convertible into shares worth a maximum of US$525 million to PT Bali Media Telekomunikasi with a term of 3 years.

tickerNews.title: INTP Cement Sales Volume Grows 10% YoY in October 2024, Market Share Rises to 28.5%
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa recorded cement sales volume growth of +10% YoY in October 2024 (including Semen Grobogan), with market share rising to 28.5% (vs. October 2023: 25.9%) because industry-wide sales volume only increased by +0.2%. INTP's sales volume growth was supported by Java Island (+13% YoY), with Central Java experiencing significant growth (+55% YoY) due to the consolidation of Semen Grobogan. INTP management believes that the October 2024 sales volume will be the highest throughout 2024 as the rate of construction slows down due to regional elections and the rainy season. In terms of product segmentation, bagged cement sales grew +2.6% YoY and bulk cement grew by +30% YoY. During 10M24, INTP's sales volume grew by +9.6% to 15.5 million tons.

tickerNews.title: GJTL Secures Rp4.4 Trillion Syndicated Credit Facility for Refinancing and Expansion
tickerNews.content: Gajah Tunggal [obtained](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202411/6dbdf0f845_84c46ced6a.pdf) a syndicated credit facility worth Rp4.4 trillion, which includes 2 tranches with tenors of 8 and 9 years respectively. The funds are intended for refinancing and financing the company's production facility expansion projects.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Director Purchased 1 Million Shares, Increasing Ownership to 12.62%
tickerNews.content: Medikaloka Hermina Director, Yulisar Khiat, purchased 1 million HEAL shares at an average price of 1,432.5 rupiah per share on November 6, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.4 billion rupiah. After [this transaction](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202411/6a60c7e73c_91c78a112c.pdf), Yulisar's ownership in HEAL increased from 12.61% to 12.62%.

tickerNews.title: FAPA Cancels Planned Share Buyback as Evaluation is Ongoing
tickerNews.content: FAP Agri [announced](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202411/94bdf30714_08a51b4f21.pdf) the cancellation of the planned share buyback previously disclosed in an information disclosure on [November 6, 2024](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202411/b11d542708_1ccf9f32e2.pdf) because the evaluation regarding the corporate action is still ongoing.

tickerNews.title: BBRI, BBNI, BMRI, TLKM, PGAS Among 8 SOEs Tapped for Free Nutritious Food Program
tickerNews.content: Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, ordered 8 SOEs to successfully implement the Free Nutritious Food program. These companies [include, among others,](https://epaper.bisnis.com/epaper/detail/page/147142/) Bank Rakyat Indonesia ($BBRI), Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI), Bank Mandiri ($BMRI), Telkom Indonesia ($TLKM), Perusahaan Gas Negara ($PGAS), PT PLN, ID Survey, and the Pupuk Indonesia holding company.

tickerNews.title: APLN Sells Hotel Pullman Ciawi Vimala Hills Resort Spa & Convention Assets to PT Bangun Loka Indah
tickerNews.content: Agung Podomoro Land ($APLN) through its subsidiary, PT Putra Adhi Prima, announced the sale of assets comprising land and buildings related to the Pullman Ciawi Vimala Hills Resort Spa & Convention Hotel, as well as other land plots, to PT Bangun Loka Indah. However, the total value of [this transaction](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202411/8e38080a91_872be4ad96.pdf) has not been announced.

tickerNews.title: AMRT Director Solihin Elected Chairman of Aprindo for 2024-2028 Period
tickerNews.content: The Director of Sumber Alfaria Trijaya ($AMRT), Solihin, was officially elected as the General Chairman of the Indonesian Retail Entrepreneurs Association (Aprindo) for the 2024-2028 period on Saturday (16/11), replacing Roy Nicolas Mandey. Previously, Solihin served as the Secretary General of Aprindo for the 2019-2024 period.](https://www.cnnindonesia.com/ekonomi/20241117174727-92-1167602/gantikan-roy-mandey-bos-alfamart-solihin-jadi-ketua-aprindo-2024-2028)
